bioghist.p: Villanova University traces its origins to old Saint Augustine's Church in Philadelphia, which the Augustinians founded in 1796, and to its parish school, Saint Augustine's Academy, established in 1811. Villanova University has been sponsored by the Augustinian Order since its founding in 1842. Today, the University is comprised of five colleges: Liberal Arts and Sciences (Villanova College), Engineering, School of Business (formerly known as the College of Commerce and Finance), Nursing and the School of Law.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of various student organizations. The materials document academic, cultural, professional, governance, community service, social, and political organizations. Materials include programs, brochures, posters, reports, schedules, handbooks, constitutions, news clippings, and a small amount of correspondence. Of note are surveys, questionnaires, and correspondence of the Student Government Association and the Student Life Committee related to the University's visitation policy; programs of the Turf and Tinsel Club (1943-1963); histories of WVIL and of the Villanova chapter of Tau Beta Pi; and minutes of the Belle Masque Society and the Beta Gamma Society (1929-1935).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
